channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An ex-Apple engineer just raised $14 million for his own defense startup, which borrows a key strategy from Apple and Tesla
item.description: "Our adversaries are arming themselves with emerging technologies at a rapid industrial scale," says CEO Dimitrios Kottas.

item.title: Wallis Annenberg, whose family made billions from selling to Rupert Murdoch and poured them back into California, dead at 86
item.description: The Wallis Annenberg Wildlife Crossing, the world's largest bridge for animals on the move, will open next year over an LA freeway.

item.title: Tsunami Reaches U.S., and Trump’s Former Lawyer Confirmed as Judge
item.description: Plus, how people are helping discover new species with their phones.

item.title: Brazil’s President Lula Voices Frustration With Trump Amid Tariff Battle
item.description: Faced with threats of 50 percent tariffs and demands to end a criminal case, President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said he wouldn’t take orders from Pre...

item.title: Football’s Brain Injuries
item.description: We explain what we know about the disease after the shooting in Manhattan.

item.title: ‘Everybody’s complaining they ain’t never seen it this hot’: Central and Eastern U.S. suffers through ‘dangerous and prolonged’ heat
item.description: The all-time high temperature at Tampa International Airport was broken on Sunday when the thermometer hit 100 degrees Fahrenheit (37.8 degrees Celsiu...

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne’s Coffin Is Taken Through His Hometown’s Streets Before Funeral
item.description: A cortege took the singer’s coffin through the streets of his hometown, Birmingham, England, on Wednesday.

item.title: The CEO of Brooks Running believes ‘if you put one foot in front of the other, you’re our customer’
item.description: Brooks Running "has a big tent to invite many people in," CEO Dan Sheridan told Fortune. "More people are investing in themselves through health and w...

item.title: Russia rocked by one of the most powerful earthquakes of the century, sending tsunami warning across Pacific
item.description: The quake registered a magnitude of 8.8 and was centered off the coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia's Far East, according to the U.S. Geologic...

item.title: A Seaside Refuge in Gaza, Torn Apart by an Israeli Strike
item.description: The Israeli military said it killed at least three Hamas operatives at Al-Baqa Cafe. It also killed a journalist, an artist and two best friends recon...

item.title: Palm Beach Billionaires Battle for Oceanfront Land
item.description: Before building the beachfront homes of their dreams, the superrich keep tearing down perfectly good mansions.

item.title: Family and Fans Pay Tribute to Ozzy Osbourne at Funeral Procession

item.title: Pro-Palestinian Protest Group Can Appeal U.K. Ban, Judge Rules
item.description: A High Court judge in London said that Palestine Action had the right to challenge the British government’s decision to ban it as a terrorist group.

item.title: Tsunami Alerts Are Mostly Lifted After Major Pacific Quake
